backend/main.mo: Defines the main actor with user profiles, cards, custom categories, transactions, and access control, providing storage and user-facing CRUD/query methods.
backend/migration.mo: Implements migration logic converting an outdated actor state into the new upgraded structure for user profiles and data.
feature_evidence.json: Lists feature evidence entries mapping product features to affected frontend files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Contains prewritten summaries of all major frontend files describing their components, pages, hooks, and UI state modules.
frontend/index.css: Defines global Tailwind-based styles and OKLCH color variables for light and dark themes.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML entry point mounting the React application via main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React layout and routing setup using TanStack Router with navigation, theming, and page mounting.
frontend/src/components/cards/CardFormDi: Modal form for creating or editing a card, handling name, color selection, and CSV mapping defaults with mutation submission.
frontend/src/components/cards/CardListIt: Displays a card entry with upload status, edit button, and an upload statement action.
frontend/src/components/cards/StatementU: Handles CSV file selection, parses transactions, triggers processing, and manages upload errors and mapping validation.
frontend/src/components/settings/Categor: UI for mapping card-provided categories to custom categories, allowing creation of new mappings.
frontend/src/components/settings/CsvMapp: Editor for configuring per-card CSV column indexes and saving updated mappings.
frontend/src/components/settings/CustomC: Manages creation of custom categories and toggling their need/want type.
frontend/src/components/transactions/Tra: Generates export text for transactions and provides a copy-to-clipboard interface.
Renders a table of transactions with category and need/want resolution, applying overrides and user-editable selections.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages an authenticated or anonymous backend actor, invalidating dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity login, logout, and identity state management using AuthClient and React context.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for cards, categories, transactions, and related mutations using the backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Configures Tailwind CSS with light/dark theme variables and base styles.
frontend/src/lib/csvImport.ts: Parses CSV data into transactions based on a card’s column mapping and category mappings.
frontend/src/lib/transactionsExport.ts: Formats transactions into a tab‑delimited export string, applying category and need/want overrides.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with QueryClient and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/CardsManagerPage.tsx: Displays and manages credit card accounts, supports adding/editing cards, uploading statements, and resetting all transactions.
frontend/src/pages/SettingsPage.tsx: Provides tabs to manage custom categories, category mappings, and per-card CSV column mappings.
frontend/src/pages/TransactionsPage.tsx: Shows imported transactions with loading/empty states and provides a table plus export functionality.
frontend/src/state/transactionCategoryOv: Zustand store for per-transaction custom category overrides keyed by a deterministic transaction ID.
frontend/src/state/transactionNeedWantOv: Zustand store for per-transaction need/want overrides, removing entries when set to auto.
frontend/src/state/uploadStatus.ts: Zustand store tracking which cards have uploaded statements and providing helpers to mark or clear uploads.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utilities for reading, persisting, and clearing URL parameters and session-stored parameters.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom theme extensions, plugins, and styling tokens.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing app purpose, architecture notes, requirements, and implemented features.
